info.title: FHIR Medication-Dispense resource API documentation
info.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "Resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation.

get.description:
Returns MedicationDispenses based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for MedicationDispense.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's data using a fulltext search

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The resource identity

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: The resource language

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given profile

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given security labels

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's narrative using a fulltext search

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Return dispenses of this medicine code

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Return dispenses that should be sent to a specific destination

parameters.name: dispenser
parameters.description: Return all dispenses performed by a specific individual

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Return dispenses with this external identifier

parameters.name: medication
parameters.description: Return dispenses of this medicine resource

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The identity of a patient to list dispenses  for

parameters.name: prescription
parameters.description: The identity of a prescription to list dispenses from

parameters.name: receiver
parameters.description: Who collected the medication

parameters.name: responsibleparty
parameters.description: Return all dispenses with the specified responsible party

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the dispense

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Return all dispenses of a specific type

parameters.name: whenhandedover
parameters.description: Date when medication handed over to patient (outpatient setting), or supplied to ward or clinic (inpatient setting). The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: whenprepared
parameters.description: Date when medication prepared. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

put.description:
The conditional update interaction is used to update an existing MedicationDispense based on some identification criteria, rather than by logical id.
